snippet: This year, for the first time, a third of the nation’s 25- to 29-year-olds have earned at least a bachelor’s degree, according to an analysis of newly available census data.
abstract: Pew Research Center analysis of newly available census data shows that one third of 25- to 29-year-olds in the United States have earned at least a bachelor's degree for the first time; record number of young Americans are completing high school, going to college and finishing college, attributable to recession and a sluggish jobs recovery that has pushed young people to see higher education as their best option for long-term employment.
lead_paragraph: This year, for the first time, a third of the nation’s 25- to 29-year-olds have earned at least a bachelor’s degree, according to an analysis of newly available census data.

headline.seo: Record Number of Young Americans Earn Bachelor’s Degree
headline.main: Record Number Complete High School and College
headline.print_headline: Record Number Complete High School and College
